intro: Spermacoce hedyotidea, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and small, yellowish-white flowers clustered in cymes. It produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Spermacoce hedyotidea is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some areas.
